results.title: Buffy. Season 4. Part 2. Eps 56-66
results.creator_credit: Joss Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season four of Buffy the vampire slayer saw the ‘scooby’ gang heading off to university (except for Xander who faced a year of unemployment and low paid jobs). Naturally with this new environment the dynamics change. No longer is Buffy the master of her own destiny as she discovers in the opening episode (ep. 45 The Freshman). In fact, university life proves to be a difficult adjustment for the slayer as band of campus vampires target the fragile Buffy and she misjudges the intentions of the campus lothario. Meanwhile, Willow (Alyson Hannigan) has come into her own, University proves to be an exciting challenge for the trainee wicca and the beginning of a new relationship with fellow campus witch, Tara (Amber Benson). There are some welcome returns (and not so welcome) to Sunnydale, notably Anya (Emma Caulfield), an ex-vengeance demon who decides to romantically pursue Xander. The other returning character is the indestructible vampire Spike (James Marsters) who returns with a new girlfriend in tow, the flaky Harmony (ep. 47 The Harsh light of day). The big season arc turns out to be the revelation that Sunnydale college also contains a secret initiative set up by the government to combat the demon problem (ep. 51 The Initiative). Buffy unwittingly becomes involved with the covert group when she falls for one of its soldiers, Riley Finn (Marc Blucas). Midway into the season the ‘big bad’, Adam, is revealed as being an ‘initiative’ experiment gone wrong (shades of Frankenstein echo throughout the season). Considered one of the more difficult years by fans, Whedon and his band of writers fashioned a more mature season that saw the gang entering into more emotionally complex terrain, as the realities of college life and adulthood threatened to split their friendships apart. The season curiously ended with a stand alone episode which hinted at difficult times ahead for the slayer. (ep. 66 Restless). Cast includes: Anthony Stewart Head, Eliza Dushku, Nicholas Brendon, Lindsay Crouse, Kristine Sutherland, Seth Green, David Boreanaz.

results.title: Temperature, pulse and respiration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates how to take the pulse, temperature, and respiration explaining how to accomplish these tasks methodically and pointing out the location where the pulse beat may be heard.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season four of Buffy the vampire slayer saw the ‘scooby’ gang heading off to university (except for Xander who faced a year of unemployment and low paid jobs). Naturally with this new environment the dynamics change. No longer is Buffy the master of her own destiny as she discovers in the opening episode (ep, 45 The Freshman). In fact, university life proves to be a difficult adjustment for the slayer as a band of campus vampires target the fragile Buffy and she misjudges the intentions of the campus lothario. Meanwhile, Willow (Alyson Hannigan) has come into her own. University proves to be an exciting challenge for the trainee wicca and the beginning of a new relationship with fellow campus witch, Tara (Amber Benson). There are some welcome returns (and not so welcome) to Sunnydale, notably Anya (Emma Caulfield), an ex-vengeance demon who decides to romantically pursue Xander. The other returning character is the indestructible vampire Spike (James Marsters) who returns with a new girlfriend in tow, the flaky Harmony (ep. 47 The Harsh light of day). The big season arc turns out to be the revelation that Sunnydale college also contains a secret initiative set up by the government to combat the demon problem (ep. 51 The Initiative). Buffy unwittingly becomes involved with the covert group when she falls for one of its soldiers, Riley Finn (Marc Blucas). Midway into the season the ‘big bad’ is revealed as being an ‘initiative’ experiment gone wrong, Adam (shades of Frankenstein echo throughout the season). Considered one of the more difficult years by fans, Whedon and his band of writers fashioned a more mature season that saw the gang entering into more emotionally complex terrain, as the realities of college life and adulthood threatened to split their friendships apart. The season curiously ended with a stand alone episode which hinted at difficult times ahead for the slayer. (ep. 66 Restless). results.title: Surgical dressings
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates the application of surgical dressings in a naval hospital during World War II. Shows the correct procedures for setting-up the trolley containing instruments, dressings and disposal items. Shows how to minimise infection by ensuring procedures are as sterile as possible.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”

description_for_label:

results.title: Giving an enema
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Discusses two main types of enemas, retention and evacuant, and demonstrates the procedure for giving them. Emphasises the importance of after-care of the patient and sterilization of equipment.

results.title: Evening Care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Stresses the obligation of each hospital corpsman is to be cheerful and to make each patient comfortable. Demonstrates the alcohol rub which will prevent pressure sores.

results.title: Beds and appliances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
This film, produced by the U.S. Navy, demonstrates how to make and manipulate beds for the sick and injured (particularly those bedridden for extended periods of time) so that the patient’s comfort is increased and their recovery is thereby quickened. Demonstrates how to make a bunk as well as a bed in a ward so that the bedclothes do no need adjusting during the day, and also includes handy tips for materials which can be used to improvise elevations and inclines to vary a patient’s position in bed. No other credits available.

results.title: Buffy. Season 2. Part 1. Eps 01-12 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josh Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season two of Joss Whedon’s cult series saw the introduction of Vampires Spike (James Marsters) and Drusilla (Juliet Landau) (Ep. 3 School hard), this seasons resident ‘big-bads’. This was the year that “Buffy the Vampire slayer’s” popularity went from small cult following to full blown media event, gaining some of the highest ratings the show has ever had in the US. Season two also saw the introduction of the cool and mysterious Oz (Seth Green), who became a ‘Scooby gang’ regular and a potential love interest for Willow. Unfortunately, like everything else in Sunnydale High, gateway to the hellmouth, Oz has teen issues of the supernatural kind (Ep. 15, Phases). Love is also in the air for Zander (Nicholas Brendan) as he hooks up with the ‘cliquey’ Cordelia (Charisma Carpenter), an unlikely paring which results in much bitchy repartee (Ep. 10, What’s my line, Part two). Aside from a new slayer unexpectedly arriving on the scene (Ep. 9, What’s my line, Part One), season two’s biggest surprise ended up being the transformation of Buffy’s ‘soulful’ vampire boyfriend Angel (David Boreanaz) into the uber evil, Angelus (Ep. 13, Surprise and Ep. 14, Innocence). This causes the love struck Buffy much grief as she has to make some difficult and painful decisions (Ep. 22, Becoming, Part two). Meanwhile, Angelus makes it his personal mission to make the slayer’s life hell (Ep. 17, Passion), while joining forces with Spike and Drusilla as they attempt to awaken a demon that will suck the world into hell (Ep. 21, Becoming, Part one and Eps. 22, Becoming, Part two). Cast includes: Sarah Michele Gellar, Alyson Hannigan, Nicholas Brendan, Anthony Stewart Head.

results.title: Buffy. Season 3. Part 2. Eps 34-44 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josh Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season three of Joss Whedon’s Buffy the vampire slayer saw the show at the height of its fan base and ratings popularity. All over the globe Buffy (Sarah Michelle Gellar) had entered into the consciousness of popular culture. Season two ended with Buffy running away from Sunnydale after having to kill her one true love Angel (David Boreanaz) who had turned into the evil Angelus. Complicating matters further was Buffy’s mother Joyce (Kristine Sutherland) who discovered that her teenage daughter was a vampire slayer. Season three opens on a Sunnydale, minus Buffy which is proving a burden for the rest of the Scooby gang whose vampire skills aren’t on the same level as the slayer (Eps. one, Annie). Buffy eventually returns to Sunnydale to find a new slayer in town, the rough and impulsive Faith (Eps. three, Faith, hope and trick). Each season creator Joss Whedon and his team of writers face the challenge of providing fresh and inventive adversary’s for Buffy and her gang to fight. In season three they rise to the challenge with the introduction of the Mayor (Harry Groener), a villain whose unnerving chirpy demure hilariously clashes with his plans for world domination and the destruction of Sunnydale as we know it. With season three Whedon played up even more the hormonal havoc his teenage leads have to contend with, as Willow (Alyson Hannigan) and Xander (Nicholas Brendon) overstep the line in their friendship and a potential new romance for Buffy is thwarted by the shock return of Angel (Eps. four, Beauty and the beasts). Other highlights include the introduction of Anya (Eps. nine, The wish), a vengeance demon that grants Cordelia’s wish of a Sunnydale without Buffy and the exciting two part finale (Eps. twenty one and twenty two, Graduation day) where the Mayors apocalyptic ‘ascension’ comes to fruition. Cast includes: Seth Green, Charisma Carpenter, Anthony Stuart Head, Eliza Dushku, James Marsters.

results.title: What's on Your Mind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
Roughly contemporaneous with Hitchcock’s Spellbound, this NFB informational film is a survey of what was then the cutting edge of progressive psychiatry. Reflecting the new enthusiasm for pop-Freudianism in a North America seeking respite for it’s traumatised World War II veterans. Although punctuated by some lighter moments, the melodramatic music scoring reflects the film’s emotional tone. Although prone to many of the social prejudices of its day (witness gender politics), this film also provides an illuminating account of pioneering forms of psychodrama and child psychiatry.
